strings.Value: "What do you find so strange about this place?"
"Cast your spells, and open the passage!"
"Let's not touch the flower for now."
{n}The old wizard examines the flower, mumbling some spells. His face is a strange expression of surprise, admiration and incomprehension.{/n}

"I have seen a lot in my time, but this castle is the most incredible thing I have ever encountered. I understand more or less how it was created... But who could have done it? And the real question – why?"
"What an impossible place! If we survive this, we shall have to return here and examine everything carefully!"
"This castle wasn't built as a dungeon. No, it was once an ordinary above-ground stone fortress. Someone spent dozens if not hundreds of years, sinking it slowly and carefully into the ground."

"Of course, the weight of the ground would have crushed it like an egg, which is why its wall had to be strengthened by magic. That is why these flowers are here. – To keep the entire dungeon from crumbling!"
{n}The wizard cracks his fingers.{/n} "As soon as the passage opens, everyone run inside. The walls are very unstable here!"
"But tell me, who could have spent so much resources, time, effort? And mask it to appear like an ordinary cyclops tomb? It would be cheaper to dig a real tomb!"
"This place is incredible. I cannot even imagine what we might find at the bottom!"

"However, that is not important now. We can contemplate the wonders of the magical arts once we are out of danger. For now the important thing is that I know how to clear the passage. I only hope I am skilled enough to keep the entire building from collapsing on our heads! Tell me when you are ready, and I will try to move the flower's roots and open that wall neatly."
